summary: The Mamas & the Papas were a popular music group in the 1960s. They combined folk and rock music, with beautiful vocal harmonies. The band had four members: John Phillips, Cass Elliot, Michelle Phillips, and Denny Doherty. They made five albums and had many hit songs, like "California Dreamin'". The group was famous for their unique sound and being part of the 1960s counterculture. They were inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 1998.
title: The Mamas & the Papas
